step_feedback.feedback: While you attempted to tighten your whole body muscles during inhalation (Step 3), the inconsistent MAE values across different joints (especially the left elbow and wrist) suggest that the muscle engagement wasn't uniform. Focus on engaging all muscle groups simultaneously and equally to improve lymphatic stimulation.

The hand placement on the abdomen (Step 2) seems inconsistent, as indicated by varying MAE values. Ensure your hands remain steadily placed on your abdomen throughout the exercise to better monitor your breathing and abdominal muscle engagement.

The visualization of fluid movement to the chest (Step 3) may not be effective, as shown by the inconsistent MAE values.  Concentrate on visualizing the fluid movement and ensure that your inhalation is slow and controlled, coordinating with the muscle tightening.

The visualization of pushing fluid out during exhalation (Step 4) needs more focus. The inconsistent MAE values suggest that muscle relaxation wasn't fully achieved.  Practice relaxing your muscles completely during exhalation to enhance lymphatic drainage.

exercise_summary: The exercise execution showed inconsistencies in muscle engagement and visualization throughout the four steps.  While attempts were made to follow instructions, improvements are needed in maintaining consistent muscle tension during inhalation, complete relaxation during exhalation, and consistent hand placement.  Focus on coordinating breathing with muscle actions and visualization techniques.
